metadata.title: CVE-2023-5088 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: A bug in QEMU could cause a guest I/O operation otherwise addressed to anarbitrary disk offset to be targeted to offset 0 instead (potentiallyoverwriting the VM's boot code). This could be used, for example, by L2guests with a virtual disk (vdiskL2) stored on a virtual disk of an L1(vdiskL1) hypervisor to read and/or write data to LBA 0 of vdiskL1,potentially gaining control of L1 at its next reboot.

criterions.comment: qemu: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
